wpt.name: GC1BPMB
wpt.desc: Springton Rocks by Members of the Flying Pig Cache Team , Traditional Cache (1.5/2)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Springton Rocks
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:placed_by: Members of the Flying Pig Cache Team
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Another “Family Friendly” cache placed by members of the Flying Pig Cache Team. A 30 caliber ammo box just off one of the many popular trails found at Chester County’s Springton Manor Farm. Be sure to visit the butterfly exhibit and the barn while in the park.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The cache is a 30 cal. Ammo Box with a log book, FTF pin and standard swag inside. GOOD HUNTING!

This cache was placed with the permission of Chester County Parks & Recreation Department. All caches must have the permission of Chester County Parks and Recreation Department. Please follow all Chester County Parks and Recreation Rule and Regulations. Parks are open year-round, 8 am to sunset. Dogs are permitted on a 6' leash. Hunting may take place within the parks during applicable hunting seasons. For more information on Chester County Parks and contact information, please visit http://www.chesco.org/ccparks.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Your cords will take you to the highest spot in the park.
